Title: Lake Charles picks a KBR, Technip Energies joint venture as EPC contractor
Description: Lake Charles LNG Export Company, a subsidiary of US midstream player Energy Transfer, has selected a joint venture of US KBR and French Technip Energies to act as the engineering contractor for its proposed 16.5 mtpa export project.
Author: JS

Title: Uniper to buy 10 Bcm of pipeline gas from ConocoPhillips for 10 years
Description: German state-owned utility Uniper signed an agreement with US-based energy producer ConocoPhillips on the supply of up 10 billion m3 of natural gas via pipeline for a period of 10 years.
Author: JS

Title: TotalEnergies signs 5-year LNG deal extension with CNOOC for 1.25 mtpa
Description: TotalEnergies has announced a five-year extension of its existing sales and purchase agreement with China’s CNOOC, for the delivery of 1.25 mtpa of LNG to China until 2034.
Author: JS

Title: Glencore signs 20-year deals with Commonwealth LNG, Kimmeridge
Description: Commodities trader Glencore has signed a non-binding heads of agreement to purchase 2 mtpa of LNG from the proposed 9.3 mtpa Commonwealth LNG plant in Louisiana and the same amount in natural gas supply from gas producer Kimmeridge Texas Gas, or FTG, for a period of 20 years.
Author: JS

Title: China’s LNG buyers pause after recent buying; eye another price dip to continue winter restock
Description: Chinese buyers have hit the pause button on spot LNG purchases as prices have edged higher this week.
Author: CK

Title: China’s Senton Energy signs four-year deal with Sinopec Fuel Oil for 0.57 mt of LNG
Description: Shenzhen Stock Exchange-listed LNG distributor Senton Energy has signed an agreement to buy 0.57 mt of LNG from Sinopec Fuel Oil over a four-year period, starting next year.
Author: CK

Title: Everest Energy LNG tanker idles outside Kamchatka, looks set to unload Arctic LNG 2 cargo
Description: The sanctioned 138,028 m3 Everest Energy LNG tanker carrying the fourth cargo from Russia’s also-sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 plant in the Gydan Peninsula is idling close to the Kamchatka LNG transhipment terminal, where it is expected to discharge its cargo.
Author: CK
